skillTree.localised_description: This altar, ridden with disease, is a fitting pulpit from which the Shaman Lords preach their words of poison and death.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Although lacking the finesse of Elven magics, the sorceries of the north are no less potent, for they channel furious, Daemonic power.
Such utterly ludicrous, impossible geometry could not conceivably be the product of a sane mind; sight of it drives the untainted mad and melts their brains!

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Ruin subtly corrupts a populace from the very depths of their souls; the resultant favour feeds the Dark Powers' servants and spurs them ever onwards.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Rotblood tribe is especially holy in the eyes of the Crow, and he exhorts them to ever greater heights with each blessing of his magic
The Crow does upon the battlefield as the lowliest of crows - he feasts upon the eyes of the damned

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: A grim dark voice rolls forth from the Shaman Lord, invigorating those around him with the worship of the Crow
The vile workings of the Serpent are anathema to worshippers of the Crow

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect increases proportional to the number of enemy units in range

skillTree.localised_description: The Crow is no benevolent god - he desires the souls of the dead, and the Rotblood Tribe shall provide.
Countless times has the Rotblood Tribe risen at the command of the Crow, and countless times more shall it worship at his feet
The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spirit Leech"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spirit Leech Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Spirit Leech Upgraded"
Overcast spell: "Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded"

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

effects.description: Cooldown: -30% to "Aspect of the Dread Knight"
Overcast spell: "Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Purple Sun of Xereus Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who do not bend the knee to the Crow soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.

effects.description:
Leadership: +3 for Rotblood Marauders and Rotblood Spearmen units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Rotblood Marauders and Rotblood Spearmen units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for Rotblood Marauders and Rotblood Spearmen units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +9 for Rotblood Marauders and Rotblood Spearmen units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +20 for Rotblood Marauders and Rotblood Spearmen units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In spite of their savage nature, they are possessed of a savage code of conduct and form a loose brotherhood of those considered worthy.

Vigour loss reduction: -50% for Rotblood Engorged, Rotblood Martyrs, and Rotblood Plaguespear units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Mere distance is hardly enough to escape the hail of toxic weaponry the Rotblood Tribe can bring to bear

Ammunition: +5% for Rotblood Grenadiers, Rotblood Vomitus, and Rotblood Plaguejavelins units
	(Lord's army)

Missile Strength: +5% for Rotblood Grenadiers, Rotblood Vomitus, and Rotblood Plaguejavelins units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +15% for Rotblood Grenadiers, Rotblood Vomitus, and Rotblood Plaguejavelins units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Giant, deadly, and able to take orders, this Lord’s monstrosities are especially terrifying and lethal.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +4 for Bile Trolls, Bile Giants, Giant Rot Flies, Rotblood Spawns, and Toad King units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +6 for Bile Trolls, Bile Giants, Giant Rot Flies, Rotblood Spawns, and Toad King units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +8% for Bile Trolls, Bile Giants, Giant Rot Flies, Rotblood Spawns, and Toad King units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +12% for Bile Trolls, Bile Giants, Giant Rot Flies, Rotblood Spawns, and Toad King units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Magic surrounds the Rotblood Tribe, infects their blood, and spews outward in a toxic mixture of death and pestilence

effects.description:
Melee Defence: +2 for Rotblood Blightstormer, Rotblood Lifeleech, and Pestilence Engine units
	(Lord's army)

Physical Resist: +5% for Rotblood Blightstormer, Rotblood Lifeleech, and Pestilence Engine units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +8 for Rotblood Blightstormer, Rotblood Lifeleech, and Pestilence Engine units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Flee all you like, for the hunters of the Rotblood Tribe will bring you to heel

effects.description:
Speed: +5% for Rotblood Horsemen, Rotblood Plague Chariot, and Rotblood Hounds units
	(Lord's army)

Charge Bonus: +10% for Rotblood Horsemen, Rotblood Plague Chariot, and Rotblood Hounds units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Speed: +15% for Rotblood Horsemen, Rotblood Plague Chariot, and Rotblood Hounds units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Blood calls to blood... and the plagues that infect even the lowliest member of the Rotblood tribe answers.
No matter what rises against them, the Rotblood Tribe shall turn it aside and weather the storm

effects.description:
Magic Resist: +20% for Rotblood Marauders, Rotblood Spearmen, Rotblood Engorged, Rotblood Martyrs, and Rotblood Plaguespear units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Large: +8 for Rotblood Marauders, Rotblood Spearmen, Rotblood Engorged, Rotblood Martyrs, and Rotblood Plaguespear units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Pox knows no bounds, and nor do the ranged combatants of the Rotblood Tribe

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +10% for Rotblood Grenadiers, Rotblood Vomitus, Rotblood Blightstormer, Rotblood Lifeleech, and Rotblood Plaguejavelins units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Rotblood Grenadiers, Rotblood Vomitus, Rotblood Blightstormer, Rotblood Lifeleech, and Rotblood Plaguejavelins units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Papa Nurgle gifts life to all who follow in his footsteps, and he has a special place in his heart for the unwanted of Norsca

effects.description:
Physical Resist: +15% for Bile Trolls, Bile Giants, Giant Rot Flies, Rotblood Spawns, Pestilence Engine, and Toad King units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile Resist: +12% for Bile Trolls, Bile Giants, Giant Rot Flies, Rotblood Spawns, Pestilence Engine, and Toad King units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Running simply brings the hounds coming quicker, for they sense the fear in their prey

effects.description:
Ward save: 10% for Rotblood Horsemen, Rotblood Plague Chariot, and Rotblood Hounds units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: 15% for Rotblood Horsemen, Rotblood Plague Chariot, and Rotblood Hounds units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Blood calls to blood... and the plagues that infect even the lowliest member of the Rotblood tribe answers.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption – as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Just as all life is born, so it must wither and die. Before that happens comes disease, in all its disgusting, filth-ridden glory.
Battles can be lost, but can the war ever really be won? The advance of Ruin can never truly be halted once and for all.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those corrupted by Nurgle's rot flock to his putrid banner in the hope that they will be reborn anew in Grandfather's image.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Why forlorn? Are you not a king, an emperor – a champion?"

effects.description: Hero self-defence: -5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A calming presence can be a steadying hand… but also disquieting.
An assured air instils great confidence in your followers.
Such an ugly scar is always memorable.
Clearly a veteran of some heroic deed.
Skulk and sneak or shadow and stalk, theirs is a guileful nature.
Shares the intellect of a River Troll.
Others may call it decisive, but being uncompromising can be a weakness as well as a strength.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you spend almost any time too close to this vile infector you'll regret it, assuming you live to tell the tale that is.

effects.description:
Chance of a plague spreading: +12%
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Unusually subtle for one so foul, this one is skilled in spreading Nurgle's insanitary ways and words across the land.
This one finds the enemy can barely stand to come near them, let alone attack.
When this one's countless lesions and warts finish weeping and harden up, a natural, protective carapace is left behind in their place.
If a population are confined to their toilets or beds at home they're not able to spread dissent and sedition as readily, if at all.
Ogres aside, being this large and ungainly would almost certainly kill most other creatures, but when you're beloved of the Urfather it is actually an advantage.
